content.description:
Super short but really fun crimpy, balancey slab climb. If you don't use the broken ramp to the right at all, this is probably 5.12a.

Descent:

Rappel route.
content.protection: 3 bolts to closed shuts. (One anchor bolt is loose in it's hole and needs replacing)
content.location: The obvious west facing slab with 3 bolts on it looming over the belay area for Cruise Control.

content.description:
Surprisingly fun little climb. Hand and foot jam up to the ledge, then move left up onto the patina face and sling a perfect chicken head.

Descent:

Same as everything else on the Queen. From the bolts, walk off left to the notch, then back down to your right.
content.protection: BD #0.75-3 cams and a long sling for the chicken head. Two bolt anchor, no chains (shared with Beginners Lead).
content.location: First crack as you drop into the SE corner area.

content.description: The MUST do on this wall, Cruise Control heads up a slightly overhanging hand crack in a dihedral.
content.location: Located in the obvious dihedral with the perfect looking overhanging hand crack.  Leftmost route on the wall.

content.description: This awesome crack is the first crack that you come upon when arriving on the platform. A great beginner lead that eats .75's. There is an awesome variation for topropers just to the right of the crack on the face. Really good holds and good rests, the beginning is the hardest by far. Without the crack it is most likely a 5.8+.
content.protection: Gear from .4-3.  2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: First climb encountered when dropping off the boulders and onto the platform.

content.description: This climb is the middle of the three cracks on the face and heads up a large flake feature near the top.  The beginning can take spooky gear because the rock is very friable in the back of the crack.
content.protection: Gear from .4-3.  2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: Middle of the three cracks on this face.
